thread.title: Windows boot issues with Display Port
thread.title_full: Windows boot issues with Display Port - EVGA Forums

posts.text:
kmuthura New Member Total Posts : 7 2017/12/02 12:16:17 Status: offline Ribbons : 0 Re: Windows boot issues with Display Port 2017/12/06 19:41:07 ( permalink ) After hours of reading forums - looks like it is a motherboard (x58) limitation (
ASUS has something called express gate, it helps if that's enabled in BIOS. This is a splash screen that loads even before BIOS splash. It does complain that express gate installation failed (probably because I am using HDDs in AHCI mode).
As long as the express gate splash shows up on the display port monitor - then everything (express gate -> BIOS -> Marvell -> Bit Locker -> Win10) displays fine on display port monitor.
However, if you happen to start the system when 4K monitor is not switched on (OR) for some reason monitor detects signal only at the point where BIOS splash has already shown up (missed express gate splash)- then the entire thing fails right at bit-locker screen prompt with a black screen.
For now, the most reliable way is to have a monitor on DVI-D & continue on until a motherboard upgrade.
#21

thread.section_title: Thailand Forum, Travel Discussion for Thailand - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Uber/ Grab from DMK? - Bangkok
thread.title_full: Uber/ Grab from DMK? - Bangkok Forum - TripAdvisor

posts.author: Steve K
posts.text: Interesting. We are regular visitors to BKK. I have had a few drivers refuse to go but that is usually because they are near the end of a shift and if they go overtime they get fined heavily. I have had one driver try to get heavy over a fair but a couple of local lads shoed him away (I knew them). Mostly I have very little problem with taxis. I often know the going rate for a trip or I get them to put the meter on. Very rare they don't do so. I would suggest you learn a little Thai, it makes a huge difference if you can ask the way and say hello at least and "put the meter on please" etc. You can get this sort of stuff from YouTube. It will be of use elsewhere as well. I estimate I pay a third less compared with trips I made four or five years ago. Partly that is a result of knowing where to buy better value items but a lot is a result of making the effort to learn at least some of the language..
